test_case.task_description: Write a compact, concise 1 day meal plan for a single athlete
test_case.scenario: Budget-conscious collegiate athlete seeking affordable, performance-optimized meal planning

While meeting all core criteria, there are minor areas for potential optimization around budget and variety.

Athlete Meal Plan: Vegan, Gluten-Free Endurance Cyclist

- Carbohydrates: 50% (394g)
- Fats: 25% (88g)

  - Roasted sweet potato (200g)

  - Avocado (80g)
  - Pumpkin seeds (30g)

- Smoothie:
  - Spinach (50g)
  - Banana (100g)
  - Pea protein powder (30g)
  - Almond butter (20g)
  - Coconut water (200ml)

🍽️ Dinner (7:00 PM) - 700 calories
- Tofu and vegetable stir-fry:
  - Firm tofu (200g)
  - Mixed vegetables (250g)

Macros: 50g protein, 80g carbs, 25g fat

Evening Recovery Drink (9:00 PM) - 300 calories

  - Brown rice protein (40g)
  - Almond milk (250ml)
  - Turmeric
  - Cinnamon
Macros: 35g protein, 30g carbs, 10g fat

- Carbohydrates: 370g
- Fats: 130g

- Height: 182 cm

- Activity Level: Ultra-endurance mountain runner

- Total Daily Calories: 3,050 calories

- Carbohydrates: 55% (420g)
- Fat: 20% (68g)

Pre-Dawn Meal (5:30 AM) - 500 calories

Mid-Morning Pre-Training (8:00 AM) - 400 calories

- Coconut oil (15g)

During Training Nutrition (Continuous intake)

Post-Training Recovery (12:30 PM) - 650 calories

- Olive oil (20g)

- Avocado (100g)

- Sweet potato mash (200g)
- Steamed broccoli (200g)
- Coconut oil (15g)
Macros: 45g protein, 70g carbs, 20g fat

Evening Recovery Shake (9:00 PM) - 250 calories
- Pea protein isolate (40g)
- Almond milk (250ml)
- Mixed berries (100g)
Macros: 30g protein, 20g carbs, 5g fat

Daily Total:
- Calories: 3,050
- Protein: 220g
- Carbohydrates: 420g
- Fat: 97g

Key Nutritional Strategies:
- Gluten-free grains: Quinoa, rice
- Dairy alternatives: Almond milk
- High-quality proteins: Chicken, salmon, beef
- Complex carbohydrates for sustained energy
- Healthy fats for hormone balance

Notes:

- Consult sports nutritionist for personalized plan

prompt_inputs.goal: Maintain extreme endurance performance for ultra-marathon mountain running

solution_criteria: Includes balanced macronutrient distribution for endurance athletes
Meets gluten-free and dairy-free dietary restrictions
Offers meal variety within nutritional constraints
test_case.task_description: Write a compact, concise 1 day meal plan for a single athlete
test_case.scenario: Extreme sports athlete with high-calorie, nutrient-dense requirements (e.g., mountain climber or ultra-marathon runner)

reasoning: While the solution provides a meticulously structured meal plan with precise nutritional tracking, it critically fails to meet the 4,000 calorie requirement for an ultra-marathon mountain runner. The calorie deficit could significantly impair performance and recovery. The plan demonstrates strong attention to dietary restrictions and meal timing, but does not provide sufficient energy for the athlete's extreme endurance needs.
